stork.feather

Class PipeElement<R extends Resource>

  • java.lang.Object
    • stork.feather.PipeElement<R>
  • Type Parameters:
    R - The Resource type of this PipeElement's root.
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Sink, Tap

    public abstract class PipeElement<R extends Resource>
extends Object
    An abstract base class for anything which can serve as an element in a proxy transfer pipeline. In particular, this is the base class for Sink and Tap.

    This class implements a state machine which enforces call guards on operations that control the flow of data in a proxy transfer according to the state transition table below. 

      __________________________________________
 |          ||          |         |         |
 |       To || running  | paused  | stopped |
 |  From    ||          |         |         |
 |==========++==========+=========+=========|
 | !started || start()  |         | stop()  |
 |----------++----------+---------+---------|
 |  running ||          | pause() | stop()  |
 |----------++----------+---------+---------|
 |  paused  || resume() |         | stop()  |
 |__________||__________|_________|_________|

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public Bell<?> start()
              throws Exception
        This is called once the pipeline has been assembled to start the flow of data through this PipeElement. This method may return a Bell which will ring when this PipeElement is ready, or null to indicate that it is ready immediately.

        Exceptions thrown here or through the returned Bell will be propagated through the pipeline, and this

        No other transfer methods will be called until this method has completed and the returned Bell, if non-null, has rung. This method will be called at most once.

        Returns:
        A Bell which will ring when this PipeElement is ready.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • stop

        public void stop()
        This is called once the transfer has completed. Once stopped, the transfer cannot be started again. This may be called before start() if the transfer is canceled before it starts.

      • pause

        public void pause()
        Pause the transfer temporarily. resume() should be called to resume transfer after pausing. Implementors should assume this method will only be called from a running state.

      • resume

        public void resume()
        Resume the transfer after a pause. Implementors should assume this method will only be called from a paused state.

      • started

        public final boolean started()
        Check if the transfer started; that is, if start() has been called. Note that this will still return true if the transfer has been stopped, and will return false if the transfer was stopped without start() having been called.
        Returns:
        true if the transfer started.

      • running

        public final boolean running()
        Check if the transfer is running; that is, it has started and is neither stopped nor paused.
        Returns:
        true if the transfer is running.

      • stopped

        public final boolean stopped()
        Check if the transfer has stopped. That is, check if stop() has been called.
        Returns:
        true if the transfer has stopped.

      • paused

        public final boolean paused()
        Check if the transfer is paused, but not stopped. Another way of looking at it is to check if #resume() will affect the state of the transfer.
        Returns:
        true if the transfer is paused.

      • initialize

        public final Bell<?> initialize(Path path)
        Initialize the transfer of data for the Resource specified by path relative to the root Resource. This simply delegates to initialize(Relative).
        Parameters:
        path - the path to the Resource which should be initialized relative to the root.
        Returns:
        A Bell which will ring when data for path is ready to be drained, or null if data can begin being drained immediately.

      • initialize

        public abstract Bell<?> initialize(Relative<R> resource)
        Prepare the pipeline for the transfer of data for resource. This must be called before any data is drained for resource.

        This method returns immediately, and initialization takes place asynchronously. It may return a Bell which will be rung when the initialization process is complete and slices for path may begun being drained through this endpoint. It may also return null to indicate that transmission may begin immediately.

        Parameters:
        resource - the Resource which should be initialized, in a Relative wrapper.
        Returns:
        A Bell which will ring when data for resource is ready to be drained, or null if data can begin being drained immediately.
        Throws:
        Exception - (via bell) if the resource cannot be initialized.

      • drain

        public final void drain(Slice slice)
        Drain a Slice through the pipeline from the root Resource. This delegates to drain(Relative).
        Parameters:
        slice - a Slice being drained through the pipeline.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this method is called when the pipeline has not been initialized.

      • drain

        public final void drain(Path path,
         Slice slice)
        Drain a Slice through the pipeline for the Resource with the given Path. This delegates to drain(Relative).
        Parameters:
        path - the path corresponding to the Resource the slice originated from.
        slice - a Slice being drained through the pipeline.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this method is called when the pipeline has not been initialized.

      • drain

        public final void drain(Relative<R> resource,
         Slice slice)
        Drain a Slice through the pipeline for the given Relative<R>. This delegates to #drain(Relative).
        Parameters:
        resource - the Resource the slice originated from.
        slice - a Slice being drained through the pipeline.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this method is called when the pipeline has not been initialized.

      • drain

        public abstract void drain(Relative<Slice> slice)
        Drain a Relative<Slice> through the pipeline. This method returns as soon as possible, with the actual I/O operation taking place asynchronously.
        Parameters:
        slice - a Slice being drained through the pipeline.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this method is called when the pipeline has not been initialized.

      • finalize

        public abstract void finalize(Relative<R> resource)
        Finalize the transfer of data for the specified Resource. This method should return immediately, and finalization should take place asynchronously.
        Parameters:
        resource - the Resource being finalized.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this method is called when the pipeline has not been initialized.

      • finalize

        public final void finalize(Path path)
        Finalize the transfer of data for the Resource specified by path. This simply delegates to finalize(Relative).
        Parameters:
        path - the path to the Resource which should be finalized relative to the root.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this method is called when the pipeline has not been initialized.

      • random

        public boolean random()
        Check if the pipeline is capable of draining Slices in arbitrary order. The return value of this method should remain constant across calls.
        Returns:
        true if transmitting slices in arbitrary order is supported.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this method is called when the pipeline has not been initialized.

      • concurrency

        public int concurrency()
        Get the number of distinct Resources the pipeline may be in the process of transferring simultaneously. Specifically, this value limits how many times #initialize(...) may be called before a corresponding #finalize(...) must be called to free up a transfer slot.

        Returning a number less than or equal to zero indicates that an arbitrary number of Resources may be transferred concurrently.

        Returns:
        The number of data Resources this sink can receive concurrently.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this method is called when the pipeline has not been initialized.
